companyMetaInformation.description:
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud, and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology, and Operations services — all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. 

Our 674,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities. Visit us at accenture.com.
companyMetaInformation.vision: Our core values shape the culture and define the character of our company. We live the core values through individual behaviors. They serve as a foundation in how we act and make decisions.
companyMetaInformation.shortBio: Accenture plc is an Irish-American, professional services company based in Dublin, specializing in information technology services and consulting.
companyMetaInformation.mission: Accenture solves our clients' toughest challenges by providing unmatched services in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. We partner with more than three-quarters of the Fortune Global 500, driving innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. With expertise across more than 40 industries and all business functions, we deliver transformational outcomes for a demanding new digital world.

Triplets with Given Sum

You are given an array/list ARR consisting of N integers. Your task is to find all the distinct triplets present in the array which adds up to a given number K.

An array is said to have a triplet {ARR[i], ARR[j], ARR[k]} with sum = 'K' if there exists three indices i, j and k such that i!=j, j!=k and i!=j and ARR[i] + ARR[j] + ARR[k] = 'K'.

Note:
1. You can return the list of values in any order. For example, if a valid triplet is {1, 2, -3}, then {2, -3, 1}, {-3, 2, 1} etc is also valid triplet. Also, the ordering of different triplets can be random i.e if there are more than one valid triplets, you can return them in any order.
2. The elements in the array need not be distinct.
3. If no such triplet is present in the array, then return an empty list, and the output printed for such a test case will be "-1".
Input Format:
The first line of the input contains an integer T, denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains the integer N, denoting the size of the array.

The second line of each test case contains N space-separated integers denoting the array elements.

The third line of each test case contains the integer K, denoting the required sum for each triplet.
Output Format:
For each test case, every line of output contains three spaced integers denoting a valid triplet as described in the statement. Refer to sample input 2 for more clarification.
Note :
You do not need to print anything, it has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints:
1 <= T <=  50
1 <= N <= 10^3  
-10^6 <= ARR[i] <= 10^6
-10^9 <= K <= 10^9

Time Limit: 1 sec

Find Duplicate

You have been given an integer array/list(ARR) of size N which contains numbers from 0 to (N - 2). Each number is present at least once. That is, if N = 5, the array/list constitutes values ranging from 0 to 3 and among these, there is a single integer value that is present twice. You need to find and return that duplicate number present in the array.

Note :
Duplicate number is always present in the given array/list.
Input format :
The first line contains an Integer 't' which denotes the number of test cases or queries to be run. Then the test cases follow.

First line of each test case or query contains an integer 'N' representing the size of the array/list.

Second line contains 'N' single space separated integers representing the elements in the array/list.
Output Format :
For each test case, print the duplicate element in the array/list.

Output for every test case will be printed in a separate line.
Constraints :
1 <= t <= 10^2
0 <= N <= 10^3
Time Limit: 1 sec

faqs.question: Who is the CEO of Accenture?
faqs.answer: Julie Sweet is the current CEO of Accenture.

faqs.question: How many employees are working in Accenture in India?
Where is the global headquarters of Accenture?
faqs.answer: Global headquarters for Accenture is located in Dublin,Ireland.

faqs.question: What cities does Accenture have offices?
faqs.answer: Accenture has offices in Dublin, Bangalore / Bengaluru, New Delhi, Noida and 1 other city.

faqs.question: What is it like to work at Accenture?
faqs.answer:
The overall rating of Accenture is 3.9, with Company culture being rated at the top and given a rating of 3.9. However, Career growth is rated the lowest at 3.3.To know first hand how is it like to work at Accenture read detailed reviews by job profile, department and location in the reviews section.
Rating scale: 5 (Excellent), 4 (Good), 3 (Average), 2 (Poor), 1 (Terrible)

faqs.question: How much is the salary at Accenture?
faqs.answer: Get detailed salary information for salaries of popular job profiles in Accenture: Application Development Analyst: ₹ 7,40,000 per year, Application Development - Senior Analyst: ₹ 12,30,000 per year and many more. Click here to view detailed Accenture Salaries.

faqs.question: What are the working days at Accenture?
faqs.answer: 85% of employees reported the working days at Accenture as Monday to Friday, whereas 11% reported them as Rotational Shift.

faqs.question: What are the working hours at Accenture?
faqs.answer: 65% employees reported the work timings at Accenture as flexible. Whereas, 35% reported it as strict, with a majority as 9 am - 6 pm and 5 pm - 2.30 am.

faqs.question: How much is the salary for freshers at  Accenture?
faqs.answer: The average salary at Accenture for freshers varies from ₹ 1,40,000 per year for Data Analytics Intern to ₹ 26,60,000 per year for Management Consulting Analyst. View Fresher Salaries at Accenture here.
